front.text: Each verse is divided into several cards. This makes them easier to memorize. Cards can be flipped and swiped.

back.text: Swipe left or right to move to the next card.

front.text: The 'Inbox' deck contains cards of the verses you are memorizing. It may take several days to master the card.

back.text: When you have memorized a card, swipe it up.

front.text: There are two cards in the Inbox for each verse: the text or the translation on the front and a word-for-word translation on the reverse side.

back.text: You can add multiple verses and learn them simultaneously.

front.text: Memorized cards are transferred to the 'Review' deck for long-term memorization.

back.text: A system of spaced repetitions is used for long-term memorization.

front.text: Each verse in this deck is divided into several cards, with a question on the front side and an answer on the other.

back.text: The answer is on this side of the card. Now you can evaluate how well your answer was.

front.text: If you answered “Good” or “Easy,” then the intervals between repetitions increase; otherwise, they decrease.

back.text: This reduces the number of daily repetitions and the learning process becomes more efficient.
